page.title: 13ARTS AND CRAFTS IN EDGEFIELD
page.content: The Edgefield gallery is near the village green and is run by Trevor Taylor, a painter from Nottinghamshire who typically paints buildings and farm animals against dramatic stormy skies. Other artists living in the village include Mary Millar Watt, who specialises in watercolour flower paintings, and Sarah Merlen who paints birds. The Edgefield pottery is in a 16th century building on the edge of the village on the Norwich-Holt road: its welcoming sign offering tea and coffee and its large car park entice holiday makers in to see the workshop in action and to eat and drink surrounded by an attractive range of mugs, bowls,pots & vases. This is a family concern exuding an air of busy contentment.
